answers.answer: Its good info. There are always people looking to get in trials and there are plenty on this site you posted.Good idea to post it here Margo so all can see.
Ha Ha well I thought so but maybe the individual forums are best I will do that I think, some folks like to get the latest Medsit came into me via a health e-mail I subscribe to .Thanks Myown
this is good valuable information to share,,ty Margy,

Yup there is actually one going on now in LA regarding Alzheimers , we need all the input we can about it, and with so many babyboomers, a break through with meds would be good news, I believe that anyone with a risk history and some memory loss  can get onto these trials and get the new meds up front . In cidently I have heard of a new one called 'Rember' that is in its 3rd year of trials being tested that they truly could be a break through. I have a family member struggling in the early stages but not yet diagnosed,so I have an added interest ,Thanks guys .

question: Hi Guys I thought this may be a good place to put this up so all may see and pass the word on...these are some clinical Trials coming up for any who want to be a part and test out the newest in Medications./treatments ....you can visit ClinicalConnection.com or put in the individual trial, Restless legs Sydrome in 15 locations nationwide,   Advanced Colorectal Cancer 11 locations,    High Blood Pressure ( Hypertension) in African Americans 87 locations Nationwide,   Parkinsons Disease 8 locations  , Atrial Fibrillation 60 locations nationwide,   Diabetes 15 locations nationwide. If you go to the sites they will give you the information the trials are free and sometimes there is re- embursment and travel costs paid .
title: Clinical Trials
